intro: Matricaria trichophylla, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and the leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. Matricaria trichophylla is often used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
